title: Email Delivery Made Simple - Unofficial Postmark API Integration for R
text: postmarkr provides clean, object-oriented API sending emails Postmark. package supports two message types (email template) two delivery modes (individual batch):

title: Email Delivery Made Simple - Unofficial Postmark API Integration for R
text: Send single email custom HTML text content:
code:
library(postmarkr) # Create client client <- client( token = Sys.getenv("POSTMARK_SERVER_TOKEN"), message_stream = "outbound" ) # Create and send email email <- Email( from = "sender@example.com", to = "recipient@example.com", subject = "Welcome to postmarkr", html_body = "

Hello!

Welcome to our service.

", track_opens = TRUE ) result <- send(client, email)

title: Email Delivery Made Simple - Unofficial Postmark API Integration for R
text: Send single email using predefined Postmark template:
code: template <- Template(   from = "notifications@example.com",   to = "user@example.com",   id = 36620093L,   template_model = list(     user_name = "Alice",     company_name = "ACME Corp"   ),   track_opens = TRUE )  result <- send(client, template)

title: Email Delivery Made Simple - Unofficial Postmark API Integration for R
text: Send multiple custom emails efficiently (automatically chunks groups 500):
code:
# Create multiple personalized emails emails <- lapply(recipients, function(recipient) { Email( from = "sender@example.com", to = recipient, html_body = "

Hi %s, welcome aboard!

" ) }) # Wrap in batch and send batch <- Batch(messages = emails) result <- send(client, batch)

title: Email Delivery Made Simple - Unofficial Postmark API Integration for R
text: Send multiple template emails (e.g., newsletters, notifications):
code: # Create template emails for each recipient templates <- lapply(recipients, function(recipient) {   Template(     from = "newsletter@example.com",     to = recipient,     id = 36620093L,     template_model = list(       user_name = "Alice",       company_name = "ACME Corp"     )   ) })  # Wrap in batch and send batch <- Batch(messages = templates) result <- send(client, batch)

what: Batch Object - Collection of Email or Template Objects — batch
title: Batch Object - Collection of Email or Template Objects — batch
text: Creates Batch object sending multiple emails templates via Postmark batch API. wraps collection messages (either Email Template objects) manages complexities Postmark's batch API: Homogeneity validation: messages must type (either Email Template) Automatic chunking: Splits large batches API-compliant chunks 500 messages (Postmark's limit) Configurable chunk size: Allows smaller chunks testing rate limiting Batch API Endpoints: Email messages: /email/batch Template messages: /email/batchWithTemplates Important Limitations: Maximum 500 messages per API call (handled automatically via chunking) Maximum 50 MB total payload size per chunk message still subject individual limits (50 recipients, 10 MB)

title: Batch Object - Collection of Email or Template Objects — batch
code: batch(messages, chunk_size = POSTMARK_MAX_BATCH_SIZE)  Batch(messages = list(), chunk_size = 500L)

title: Batch Object - Collection of Email or Template Objects — batch
text: messages List Email Template objects. must class. Use lapply() similar create multiple messages programmatically. chunk_size Integer scalar. Maximum messages per API call. Default 500 (Postmark's limit). Set lower testing (e.g., 50) conservative rate limiting (e.g., 100). Must positive exceed 500.

title: Batch Object - Collection of Email or Template Objects — batch
code:
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Batch of regular emails (e.g., 1000 personalized emails) emails <- lapply(1:1000, function(i) { email( from = "sender@example.com", to = sprintf("user%d@example.com", i), subject = sprintf("Welcome User %d", i), html_body = sprintf("

Hello User %d!

", i) ) }) my_batch <- batch(messages = emails) # Send batch client <- client(token = "", message_stream = "outbound") result <- send(client, my_batch) # Batch of template emails recipients <- c("alice@example.com", "bob@example.com", "charlie@example.com") templates <- lapply(recipients, function(email) { template( from = "notifications@example.com", to = email, id = 12345678L, template_model = list( company_name = "ACME Corp" ) ) }) my_batch <- batch(messages = templates) send(client, my_batch) } # }

title: Client Object — client
text: token character. Postmark Server API Token. token authenticates requests Postmark API. message_stream character. message stream use sending emails. Must either "broadcast" (newsletters marketing emails) "outbound" (transactional one--one triggered emails). timeout numeric. Request timeout seconds API calls. 60 seconds default. verbose logical. Whether pass httr2::req_verbose() request. base_url character. base URL Postmark API. Defaults standard Postmark API endpoint (https://api.postmarkapp.com). need change .

title: Email Object — email
code: email(   from = character(0),   to = character(0),   subject = character(0),   html_body = character(0),   text_body = character(0),   cc = character(0),   bcc = character(0),   tag = character(0),   reply_to = character(0),   metadata = list(),   headers = list(),   track_opens = logical(0),   track_links = character(0),   attachments = list() )  Email(   from = character(0),   to = character(0),   cc = character(0),   bcc = character(0),   subject = character(0),   tag = character(0),   html_body = character(0),   text_body = character(0),   reply_to = character(0),   metadata = list(),   headers = list(),   track_opens = logical(0),   track_links = character(0),   attachments = list() )

title: Email Object — email
text: Character scalar. Required. Sender email address (must verified Postmark). Supports name formatting: "John Doe <email@example.com>" Character vector. Required. Recipient email addresses. Multiple recipients allowed (max 50 total across , Cc, Bcc) subject Character scalar. Email subject line. html_body Character scalar. HTML content email. Use rich formatting, images, styling. Mutually exclusive text_body. Maximum 5 MB. text_body Character scalar. Plain text content email. Use simple text-emails. Mutually exclusive html_body. Maximum 5 MB. cc Character vector. Carbon copy recipients. Visible recipients. bcc Character vector. Blind carbon copy recipients. Hidden recipients. tag Character scalar. Category tag statistics filtering. One tag per message, maximum 1000 characters. Examples: "welcome-email", "password-reset", "invoice". reply_to Character scalar. Reply-address responses. metadata List. Key-value pairs internal tracking. affect email delivery. Example: list(customer_id = "12345", campaign = "onboarding"). headers List lists. Custom email headers. element Name Value keys. Example: list(list(Name = "X-Priority", Value = "High")). Use custom routing, priority settings, Message-ID override. track_opens Logical scalar. Enable open tracking using invisible pixel. works HTML emails. Provides insights emails opened. track_links Character scalar. Link tracking mode. Options: "None" (tracking), "HtmlAndText" (track links), "HtmlOnly" (HTML links ), "TextOnly" (text links ). Replaces URLs tracking URLs redirect original destination. attachments List lists. File attachments inline images. attachment Name, Content (base64-encoded), ContentType, optionally ContentID (inline images) keys. Total message size including attachments limited 10 MB.

title: Email Object — email
text: Maximum 50 total recipients (, Cc, Bcc combined) Maximum 10 MB total message size (including attachments) One tag per message, maximum 1000 characters

title: Email Object — email
code:
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Simple text Email simple_email <- email( from = "sender@example.com", to = "recipient@example.com", subject = "Hello from R", text_body = "This is a plain text email." ) # HTML Email with tracking html_email <- email( from = "sender@example.com", to = "recipient@example.com", subject = "Welcome!", html_body = "

Welcome!

Thanks for signing up.

", track_opens = TRUE, track_links = "HtmlOnly", tag = "welcome-email" ) # Email with multiple recipients and metadata multi_email <- email( from = "notifications@example.com", to = c("user1@example.com", "user2@example.com"), cc = "manager@example.com", subject = "Project Update", html_body = "

Project status update attached.

", metadata = list( project_id = "ABC123", department = "Engineering" ), tag = "project-updates" ) # Email with custom headers priority_email <- email( from = "urgent@example.com", to = "support@example.com", subject = "Urgent Issue", text_body = "This requires immediate attention.", headers = list( list(Name = "X-Priority", Value = "1"), list(Name = "Importance", Value = "high") ) ) } # }

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create client client <- Client( token = "your-server-token", message_stream = "outbound" ) # Send a regular email email <- Email( from = "sender@example.com", to = "recipient@example.com", subject = "Hello from postmarkr", text_body = "This is a test email sent via R." ) response <- send(client, email) # Check if successful if (response@success) { cat("Email sent successfully! ") cat("Message ID:", response@data$MessageID, " ") cat("Submitted at:", response@data$SubmittedAt, " ") } # Send HTML email with tracking html_email <- Email( from = "notifications@example.com", to = "user@example.com", subject = "Welcome to our service", html_body = "

Welcome!

Thanks for signing up.

", track_opens = TRUE, track_links = "HtmlOnly", tag = "welcome-email" ) response <- send(client, html_email) # Send a template email template <- Template( from = "sender@example.com", to = "recipient@example.com", id = 12345678L, template_model = list(name = "John", order_id = "ORD-123") ) response <- send(client, template) } # }

text: Creates Template object sending template-based emails via Postmark API. provides structured way send emails using predefined Postmark templates. supports: Template variable substitution via template_model Multiple recipients via , Cc, Bcc fields (max 50 combined) Inline CSS processing better email client compatibility Open click tracking configuration Email categorization via tags File attachments custom headers Metadata internal tracking

code: template(   template_model,   from = character(0),   to = character(0),   id = numeric(0),   alias = character(0),   cc = character(0),   bcc = character(0),   inline_css = logical(0),   tag = character(0),   reply_to = character(0),   headers = list(),   track_opens = logical(0),   track_links = character(0),   attachments = list(),   metadata = list() )  Template(   from = character(0),   to = character(0),   id = integer(0),   alias = character(0),   template_model = list(),   cc = character(0),   bcc = character(0),   inline_css = logical(0),   tag = character(0),   reply_to = character(0),   headers = list(),   track_opens = logical(0),   track_links = character(0),   attachments = list(),   metadata = list() )

title: Template Object — template
text: template_model List. Required. Named list variables populate template. Keys must match template variable names. Can include nested lists complex data structures. template placeholders, pass empty list: list(). Example variables: list(user_name = "John", company = list(name = "ACME")). Character scalar. Required. Sender email address (must verified Postmark). Supports name formatting: "John Doe <email@example.com>" Character vector. Required. Recipient email addresses. Multiple recipients allowed (max 50 total across , Cc, Bcc) id Integer scalar. template ID Postmark. Must positive integer corresponding existing template account. Typically 8-digit number (e.g., 12345678). Mutually exclusive alias. alias Character scalar. template alias Postmark. named identifier template (e.g., "welcome-email", "password-reset"). Mutually exclusive id. cc Character vector. Carbon copy recipients. Visible recipients. bcc Character vector. Blind carbon copy recipients. Hidden recipients. inline_css Logical scalar. Whether process CSS <style> tags inline style attributes. Improves compatibility email clients. Default TRUE better rendering. tag Character scalar. Category tag statistics filtering. One tag per message, maximum 1000 characters. Examples: "welcome-email", "password-reset", "invoice". reply_to Character scalar. Reply-address responses. headers List lists. Custom email headers. element Name Value keys. Example: list(list(Name = "X-Priority", Value = "High")). Use custom routing, priority settings, Message-ID override. track_opens Logical scalar. Enable open tracking using invisible pixel. works HTML emails. Provides insights emails opened. track_links Character scalar. Link tracking mode. Options: "None" (tracking), "HtmlAndText" (track links), "HtmlOnly" (HTML links ), "TextOnly" (text links ). Replaces URLs tracking URLs redirect original destination. attachments List lists. File attachments inline images. attachment Name, Content (base64-encoded), ContentType, optionally ContentID (inline images) keys. Total message size including attachments limited 10 MB. metadata List. Key-value pairs internal tracking. affect email delivery. Example: list(customer_id = "12345", campaign = "onboarding").
